turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Cloud load balancing.
turn.1: What is the difference between Cloud load balancing and traditional load balancing?
turn.2: Cloud load balancing Cloud load balancing is a type of load balancing that is performed in cloud computing.
turn.3: What is the purpose of Cloud load balancing?
turn.4: Cloud load balancing is the process of distributing workloads across multiple computing resources.
turn.5: What are the main benefits of Cloud load balancing?
turn.6: Cloud load balancing reduces costs associated with document management systems and maximizes availability of resources.
turn.7: What are the main challenges of Cloud load balancing?
turn.8: It is a type of load balancing and not to be confused with Domain Name System (DNS) load balancing.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: While DNS load balancing uses software or hardware to perform the function, cloud load balancing uses services offered by various computer network companies.
turn.11: Can you tell me more about the services?
turn.12: Cloud load balancing has an advantage over DNS load balancing as it can transfer loads to servers globally as opposed to distributing it across local servers.
